name: Mushroom Sauce
ingredients: 1 Tbsp unsalted butter,2 Tbsp shallots,2 cups mushrooms,some  salt,2 Tbsp tarragon,2 Tbsp garlic,2 Tbsp Balsamic vinegar,1 cup red wine,1.5 cups vegetable stock,some  salt,some  pepper,3 Tbsp heavy cream,1 Tbsp parsley,2 Tbsp cornstarch (optional)
method: In a sauce pan, heat 1 tablespoon sweet butter, when hot, add shallots and cook until light golden brown and add the mushrooms and the salt and cook until they have released most of their water (this could take 7 to 10 minutes). Add the fresh or dried herbs, garlic and when fragrant (about 15 to 20 seconds) add the vinegar and wine and let it reduce until about half of it remain.Add stock and cook for 15/20 minutes.Add cream and parsley if you like. Adjust the thickness of the sauce with sweet butter or cornstarch and at the last minutes add as much butter as you like.Chef adds at least 2 large tablespoons!!!
cooklang:
In a #sauce pan{}, heat 1 tablespoon @unsalted butter{1%Tbsp}, when hot, add @shallots{2%Tbsp} and cook until light golden brown and add the @mushrooms{2%cups} and the @salt{} and cook until they have released most of their water (this could take 7 to ~{10%minutes}).

Add the @tarragon{2%Tbsp}, @garlic{2%Tbsp} and when fragrant (about 15 to 20 seconds) add the @Balsamic vinegar{2%Tbsp} and @red wine{1%cup} and let it reduce until about half of it remain. Add @vegetable stock{1.5%cups}, add @salt{} and @pepper{} to taste and cook for 15 to ~{20%minutes}. Add @heavy cream{3%Tbsp} and @parsley{1%Tbsp} if you like.

Adjust the thickness of the sauce with unsalted butter or @cornstarch (optional){2%Tbsp} when boiling a little bit at a time and at the last minutes add as much butter as you like. Chef adds at least 2 large tablespoons!!!
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
- 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
- 2 Tbsp shallots
- 2 cups mushrooms
- some salt
- 2 Tbsp tarragon
- 2 Tbsp garlic
- 2 Tbsp Balsamic vinegar
- 1 cup red wine
- 1.5 cups vegetable stock
- some pepper
- 3 Tbsp heavy cream
- 1 Tbsp parsley
- 2 Tbsp cornstarch (optional)

RECIPE:
HEAT 1 Tbsp unsalted butter IN A SAUCE PAN.
ADD 2 Tbsp shallots TO THE SAUCE PAN AND COOK UNTIL LIGHT GOLDEN BROWN.
ADD 2 cups mushrooms, some salt TO THE SAUCE PAN AND COOK UNTIL THEY HAVE RELEASED MOST OF THEIR WATER (THIS COULD TAKE 7 TO 10 MINUTES).
ADD 2 Tbsp tarragon, 2 Tbsp garlic TO THE SAUCE PAN AND COOK UNTIL FRAGRANT (ABOUT 15 TO 20 SECONDS).
ADD 2 Tbsp Balsamic vinegar, 1 cup red wine TO THE SAUCE PAN AND LET IT REDUCE UNTIL ABOUT HALF OF IT REMAINS.
ADD 1.5 cups vegetable stock TO THE SAUCE PAN AND COOK FOR 15/20 MINUTES.
ADD 3 Tbsp heavy cream, 1 Tbsp parsley IF YOU LIKE.
ADJUST THE THICKNESS OF THE SAUCE WITH 1 Tbsp unsalted butter OR 2 Tbsp cornstarch (optional) AND ADD AS MUCH BUTTER AS YOU LIKE AT THE LAST MINUTES.

name: Mushroom Gravy
ingredients: 2 large shallots,1 lb cremini mushroom,some  water,3 cloves garlic,1 tsp thyme,1 tsp sage,1 tsp rosemary,0.5 cup dry white wine,3 cups cauliflower florets,2 cups vegetable broth,0.5 tsp salt,some  pepper,2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
method: Sauté the shallots and mushroom over medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes. Add water 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time, as needed, to keep them from sticking to the pan. Add the garlic, thyme, sage, and rosemary, and cook for another minute. Add the white wine and cook until the wine is reduced by half, about 3 minutes (see tip). Add the cauliflower purée, vegetable broth, sea salt, black pepper, and nutritional yeast. Whisk well and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes until the gravy thickens some
cooklang:
Sauté the @shallots{2%large} and @cremini mushroom{1%lb} over medium heat for 5 to ~{6%minutes}. Add @water{} 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time, as needed, to keep them from sticking to the #pan{}.

Add the @garlic{3%cloves}, @thyme{1%tsp}, @sage{1%tsp}, and @rosemary{1%tsp}, and cook for ~{1%minute} more.

Add the @dry white wine{1/2%cup} and cook until the wine is reduced by half, about ~{3%minutes}.

Tip: If using lemon juice instead of white wine, you do not need to reduce the sauce.

Make a purée from steamed @cauliflower florets{3%cups}.

Add the cauliflower purée, @vegetable broth{2%cups}, sea @salt{1/2%tsp}, black @pepper{}, and @nutritional yeast{2%Tbsp}.

Whisk well and cook over medium heat for ~{10%minutes} until the gravy thickens some.
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
- 2 large shallots
- 1 lb cremini mushroom
- some water
- 3 cloves garlic
- 1 tsp thyme
- 1 tsp sage
- 1 tsp rosemary
- 0.5 cup dry white wine
- 3 cups cauliflower florets
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 0.5 tsp salt
- some pepper
- 2 Tbsp nutritional yeast

RECIPE:
SAUTE the shallots and mushroom over medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes.
ADD water 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time, as needed, to keep them from sticking to the pan.
ADD the garlic, thyme, sage, and rosemary, and cook for another minute.
REDUCE the white wine until it is reduced by half, about 3 minutes (see tip).
ADD the cauliflower puree, vegetable broth, sea salt, black pepper, and nutritional yeast. WHISK well.
COOK over medium heat for 10 minutes until the gravy thickens some.

name: Buffalo Sauce
ingredients: 0.67 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot),0.5 cup butter,1.5 Tbsp white vinegar,0.25 tsp Worcestershire sauce,0.25 tsp cayenne pepper,0.125 tsp garlic powder,some  salt
method: Gather all ingredients. Combine hot sauce, butter, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne, garlic powder, and salt in a pot over medium heat. Bring to a simmer while stirring with a whisk. As soon as the liquid begins to bubble on the sides of the pot, remove from heat, stir with the whisk, and set aside for use. Enjoy!
cooklang:
Combine @hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot){0.67%cup}, @butter{0.5%cup}, @white vinegar{1.5%Tbsp}, @Worcestershire sauce{1/4%tsp}, @cayenne pepper{0.25%tsp}, @garlic powder{0.125%tsp}, and @salt{} in a #pot{} over medium heat.

Bring to a simmer while stirring with a whisk. As soon as the liquid begins to bubble on the sides of the pot, remove from heat, stir with the whisk, and set aside for use.
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot) = 0.67 cup
butter = 0.5 cup
white vinegar = 1.5 Tbsp
Worcestershire sauce = 0.25 tsp
cayenne pepper = 0.25 tsp
garlic powder = 0.125 tsp
salt = some

RECIPE:
1. Combine hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot), butter, white vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne, garlic powder, and salt in a pot over medium heat.
2. Bring to a simmer while stirring with a whisk.
3. As soon as the liquid begins to bubble on the sides of the pot, remove from heat, stir with the whisk, and set aside for use.

name: Whipped Almond Ricotta
ingredients: 2 cups slivered blanched almonds,3 tsp nutritional yeast,2 Tbsp lemon juice,1 dash garlic powder,3 Tbsp basil, oregano, or parsley (optional),1 cup water,0.75 tsp salt
method: Add all ricotta ingredients (starting with the lesser amount of water (3/4 cup/180 ml and salt (1/2 tsp) as original recipe is written) to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth and creamy, scraping down sides as needed (
cooklang:
Add @slivered blanched almonds{2%cups}, @nutritional yeast{3%tsp}, @lemon juice{2%Tbsp}, @garlic powder{1%dash}, and @basil, oregano, or parsley (optional){3%Tbsp} (starting with the lesser amount of @water{1%cup} (3/4 cup/180 ml and @salt{3/4%tsp} (1/2 tsp) as original recipe is written) to a #high-speed blender{} and blend until smooth and creamy, scraping down sides as needed, about ~{2%minutes}. You are looking for a well-puréed mixture with only very small bits of almonds intact. Add a bit more water a little at a time if the mixture is having a hard time blending until smooth.

Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more salt for overall flavor, nutritional yeast for cheesiness, and lemon juice for acidity. For even more flavor, you can add in some fresh basil, oregano, or parsley (optional).

At this point, the “cheese” is ready to enjoy, especially in dishes like Lasagna, Pizza, or Stuffed Shells. However, it can also be wrapped in cheesecloth, formed into a ball, and placed into a fine mesh strainer set over a mixing bowl up to 3 days. This will allow the “cheese” to firm up a bit. However, this is optional. You can also transfer straight from blender to a storage container and refrigerate.

Store leftovers covered in the refrigerator up to 5-7 days.

INGREDIENTS:
- 2 cups slivered blanched almonds
- 3 tsp nutritional yeast
- 2 Tbsp lemon juice
- 1 dash garlic powder
- 3 Tbsp basil, oregano, or parsley (optional)
- 1 cup water
- 0.75 tsp salt

RECIPE:
Blend:
  - 1/4 cup water
  - 1/2 tsp salt
  - ricotta cheese
  - 2 cups slivered blanched almonds
  - 3 tsp nutritional yeast
  - 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  - 1 dash garlic powder
  - 3 Tbsp basil, oregano, or parsley (optional)

name: Roasted Red Pepper Dressing
ingredients: 2 large roasted red bell peppers,3 Tbsp apple cider vinegar (or red wine vinegar or balsamic),1 Tbsp water,1 Tbsp maple syrup,2 tsp white miso,0.5 tsp garlic powder,0.5 tsp Italian seasoning,1 small shallot (optional),1 Tbsp tahini(optional),1 tsp Dijon mustard(optional),some  lemon juice (optional),some  black pepper (optional)
method: Place all ingredients in a small blender or food processor. (Scrape out any seeds and extra liquid in the bell peppers before adding.) Blend for 20-30 seconds or until smooth. (I use a NutriBullet.) Taste and adjust flavors if desired

(Scrape out any seeds and extra liquid in the bell peppers before adding.)

Blend for 20 to ~{30%seconds} or until smooth. (I use a NutriBullet.) Taste and adjust flavors if desired.

name: Pumpkin Curry Sauce
ingredients: 1 Tbsp olive oil,1  yellow onion,1 Tbsp garlic,1 tsp ginger,2 Tbsp red curry paste,1 cup pumpkin puree,1 15-oz can coconut milk,0.5 tsp pepper,1 tsp salt
method: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add onion, garlic, and ginger to the pan. Cook the aromatics until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the red curry paste, pumpkin puree, coconut milk, pepper, and salt to the pan and stir well. Bring the curry sauce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Serve and enjoy
cooklang:
Heat the @olive oil{1%Tbsp} in a #large skillet{} over medium heat.

Once the oil is hot, add diced @yellow onion{1}, @garlic{1%Tbsp}, and @ginger{1%tsp} to the pan.

Cook the aromatics until the onion is translucent, about ~{5%minutes}.

Add the @red curry paste{2%Tbsp}, @pumpkin puree{1%cup}, @coconut milk{1%15-oz can}, @pepper{1/2%tsp}, and @salt{1%tsp} to the pan and stir well. Bring the curry sauce to a simmer and cook for ~{15%minutes}.

Serve and enjoy.

- yellow onion: 1
- garlic: 1 Tbsp
- ginger: 1 tsp
- red curry paste: 2 Tbsp
- pumpkin puree: 1 cup
- coconut milk: 15 oz (1 can)
- pepper: 0.5 tsp
- salt: 1 tsp

HEAT olive oil IN a large skillet OVER medium heat.
ADD yellow onion, garlic, and ginger TO the pan AND cook UNTIL the onion IS translucent, ABOUT 5 minutes.
ADD red curry paste, pumpkin puree, coconut milk, pepper, and salt TO the pan AND stir WELL.
BRING the curry sauce TO a simmer AND cook FOR 15 minutes.
SERVE

name: Vegan Caesar Dressing
ingredients: 0.25 cup plain hummus,1 tsp spicy mustard,1  lemon zest,1  lemon juice,2 tsp minced capers + brining juice,5 cloves minced garlic,2 Tbsp Olive oil (optional),some  hot water,some  salt,some  pepper,2 tsp Maple syrup (optional)
method: To a small mixing bowl, add hummus, spicy mustard, lemon zest + juice, minced capers + brining juice, and minced garlic, and whisk thoroughly to combine. Olive oil is optional, but will add a bit more creaminess. Add a little hot water to thin until pourable and whisk until creamy and smooth (see photo). Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more salt and pepper, lemon juice, or minced garlic if desired! Maple syrup will help offset how salty and briney this dressing is, if you find you need it (I did not). Use immediately, or store in the refrigerator up to 5-7 days. This dressing is delicious on kale, romaine, and arugula. It would also be great on roasted vegetables, especially Brussels sprouts and potatoes. Top with a little vegan parmesan cheese for the ultimate Caesar salad experience
cooklang:
To a #small mixing bowl{}, add @plain hummus{1/4%cup}, @spicy mustard{1%tsp}, @lemon zest{1}, @lemon juice{1}, @minced capers + brining juice{2%tsp}, and @minced garlic{5%cloves}, and whisk thoroughly to combine. @Olive oil (optional){2%Tbsp} is optional, but will add a bit more creaminess.

Add a little @hot water{} to thin until pourable and whisk until creamy and smooth. Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more @salt{} and @pepper{}, lemon juice, or minced garlic if desired! @Maple syrup (optional){2%tsp} will help offset how salty and briney this dressing is, if you find you need it.

Use immediately, or store in the refrigerator up to 5-7 days.

This dressing is delicious on kale, romaine, and arugula. It would also be great on roasted vegetables, especially Brussels sprouts and potatoes. Top with a little vegan Parmesan cheese for the ultimate Caesar salad experience.
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
- 0.25 cup plain hummus
- 1 tsp spicy mustard
- 1 lemon zest
- 1 lemon juice
- 2 tsp minced capers + brining juice
- 5 cloves minced garlic
- 2 Tbsp Olive oil (optional)
- some hot water
- some salt
- some pepper
- 2 tsp Maple syrup (optional)

RECIPE:
WHISK TOGETHER hummus, spicy mustard, lemon zest + juice, minced capers + brining juice, and minced garlic.
ADD Olive oil if desired for creaminess.
ADD a little hot water to thin until pourable and whisk until creamy and smooth.
TASTE AND ADJUST flavor as needed by adding more salt and pepper, lemon juice, or minced garlic.
IF NEEDED, ADD Maple syrup to offset the saltiness and brininess of the dressing.
USE IMMEDIATELY or store in refrigerator for up to 5-7 days.

name: Cilantro Dressing
ingredients: 0.333 cup rice vinegar,4 Tbsp olive oil,0.25 cup mayonnaise,3 oz cotija cheese or queso fresco,1  lime juice,1 clove garlic,1  jalapeño,0.5 cup cilantro,0.5 Tbsp salt
method: Add all ingredients to a blender in order given. Process until smooth
cooklang:
Add @rice vinegar{1/3%cup}, @olive oil{4%Tbsp}, @mayonnaise{1/4%cup}, @cotija cheese or queso fresco{3%oz}, @lime juice{1}, @garlic{1%clove}, @jalapeño{1}, @cilantro{1/2%cup}, and @salt{1/2%Tbsp} to a #blender{} in the order given.

Process until smooth.
predict_cooklang:
Add 0.333 cup rice vinegar to blender.
Add 4 Tbsp olive oil to blender.
Add 0.25 cup mayonnaise to blender.
Add 3 oz cotija cheese or queso fresco to blender.
Add 1 lime juice to blender.
Add 1 clove garlic to blender.
Add 1 jalapeño to blender.
Add 0.5 cup cilantro to blender.
Add 0.5 Tbsp salt to blender.

Process until smooth.

name: Tahini
ingredients: 1 cup sesame seeds,3 Tbsp vegetable oil,1 pinch salt
method: Add sesame seeds to a wide, dry saucepan over medium-low heat and toast, stirring constantly, until the seeds become fragrant and turn light golden, 3 to 5 minutes. Stay close and keep stirring, as the seeds can burn quickly. Add the toasted sesame seeds to the bowl of a food processor, then process until a crumbly paste, about 1 minute. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil, then process for 2 to 3 minutes more, stopping to scrape the bottom and sides of the food processor a couple of times. Check the tahini’s consistency. It should be smooth, not gritty, and should be pourable. You may need to process for another minute and add 1 to 2 more tablespoons of oil. Taste the tahini for seasoning, then add salt to taste. Process 5 to 10 seconds to mix. Store tahini in an airtight container in the fridge for one month
cooklang:
Add @sesame seeds{1%cup} to a wide, dry #saucepan{} over medium-low heat and toast, stirring constantly until the seeds become fragrant and very lightly colored (not brown), 3 to ~{5%minutes}. Careful here, sesame seeds can burn quickly.

Transfer toasted seeds to a #baking sheet or large plate{} and cool completely.

Add sesame seeds to the bowl of a #food processor{} then process until a crumbly paste, about ~{1%minute}.

Add 3 tablespoons of the @vegetable oil{3%Tbsp} then process for 2 to ~{3%minutes} more, stopping to scrape the bottom and sides of the food processor a couple of times. Check the tahini’s consistency. It should be smooth, not gritty, and should be pourable. You may need to process for another minute or add the additional tablespoon of oil.

Taste the tahini for seasoning then add @salt{1%pinch} to taste. Process 5 to 10 seconds to mix it in.

Store tahini covered in the refrigerator for one month. You may notice it separates over time, like a natural peanut butter would. If this happens, give the tahini a good stir before using.
predict_cooklang:
TOAST SESAME SEEDS:
  - INGREDIENTS: sesame seeds
  - EQUIPMENT: saucepan
  - HEAT: medium-low
  - TIME: 3-5 minutes
  - ACTION: toast, stirring constantly

MAKE TAHINI PASTE:
  - INGREDIENTS: toasted sesame seeds, vegetable oil, salt
  - EQUIPMENT: food processor
  - ACTION: process until crumbly paste (1 minute)
  - ADDITIONAL STEPS:
    - PROCESS WITH 2 TABLESPOONS OIL (2-3 minutes), stopping to scrape the bottom and sides a couple of times.
    - CHECK CONSISTENCY, PROCESS IF NECESSARY, AND ADD MORE OIL IF NEEDED
    - TASTE FOR SEASONING, ADD SALT TO TASTE

STORE TAHINI:
  - INGREDIENTS: tahini paste
  - EQUIPMENT: airtight container
  - ACTION: store in fridge for one month

name: New York-Style Pizza Sauce
ingredients: 1 28-oz can tomatoes,1 Tbsp olive oil,1 Tbsp butter,2 cloves garlic,1 tsp oregano,1 pinch pepper flakes,1 large pinch salt,1 medium yellow onion,2 sprigs basil,1 tsp sugar
method: Process tomatoes and their juice through food mill, pulse in food processor until puréed, or purée with immersion blender. Purée should not be completely smooth, but should have no chunks larger than 1/16th of an inch. Set tomatoes aside. Combine oil and butter in medium saucepan and heat over medium-low heat until butter is melted. Add garlic, oregano, pepper flakes, and a large pinch of salt and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant but not browned, about 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, onion halves, basil sprigs, and sugar. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to lowest setting (bubbles should barely be breaking the surface), and cook, stirring occasionally, until reduced by half, about 1 hour. Discard onions and basil stems. Season to taste with salt. Allow to cool and store in covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks
cooklang:
Process @tomatoes{1%28-oz can} and their juice through #food mill{}, pulse in #food processor{} until puréed, or purée with immersion blender. Purée should not be completely smooth, but should have no chunks larger than 1/16th of an inch. Set tomatoes aside.

Combine @olive oil{1%Tbsp} and @butter{1%Tbsp} in #medium saucepan{} and heat over medium-low heat until butter is melted. Add @garlic{2%cloves}, @oregano{1%tsp}, @pepper flakes{1%pinch}, and large pinch @salt{1%large pinch} and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant but not browned, about ~{3%minutes}.

Add tomatoes, @yellow onion{1%medium} halves, @basil{2%sprigs} sprigs, and @sugar{1%tsp}.

Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to lowest setting (bubbles should barely be breaking the surface), and cook, stirring occasionally, until reduced by half, about ~{1%hour}. Discard onions and basil stems. Season to taste with salt. Allow to cool and store in covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
- tomatoes
- olive oil
- butter
- garlic
- oregano
- pepper flakes
- salt
- onion
- basil
- sugar

RECIPE:
PURÉE TOMATOES THROUGH FOOD MILL OR WITH IMMERSION BLENDER.
COMBINE OIL AND BUTTER IN MEDIUM SAUCEPAN. HEAT OVER MEDIUM-LOW HEAT UNTIL BUTTER IS MELTED.

ADD GARLIC, OREGANO, PEPPER FLAKES, AND LARGE PINCH OF SALT TO SAUCEPAN. COOK FOR 3 MINUTES, STIRRING FREQUENTLY.

ADD TOMATOES, ONION HALVES, BASIL SPRIGS, AND SUGAR TO SAUCEPAN. BRING TO SIMMER. REDUCE HEAT TO LOWEST SETTING AND COOK FOR 1 HOUR, STIRRING OCCASIONALLY.

DISCARD ONIONS AND BASIL STEMS.
SEASON WITH SALT TO TASTE.

STORE IN COVERED CONTAINER IN REFRIGERATOR FOR UP TO 2 WEEKS.

name: Simple Berry Compote
ingredients: 3 cups fruit,3 Tbsp orange juice,0.25 tsp cinnamon (optional),0.25 tsp ginger (optional),1 tsp granulated sugar (optional),1 tsp chia seeds (optional)
method: Place fruit and juice in a small saucepan and bring to medium heat. Once bubbling, reduce heat slightly and use a wooden spoon to muddle and mash the fruit. Continue cooking over medium-low heat for 10-12 minutes, occasionally mashing fruit to combine. Turn off heat and add optional add-ins at this point (cinnamon, ginger, sugar, chia seeds). Remove from heat and transfer to a clean jar or container to cool thoroughly. Store in the fridge up to 1 week or freeze in ice cube molds up to 1 month. Reheat to serve with oats, pancakes, waffles, french toast, and more!
cooklang:
Place @fruit{3%cups} and @orange juice{3%Tbsp} in a #small saucepan{} and bring to medium heat.

Once bubbling, reduce heat slightly and use a #wooden spoon{} to muddle and mash the fruit.

Continue cooking over medium-low heat for 10 to ~{12%minutes}, occasionally mashing fruit to combine. Turn off heat and add optional add-ins at this point (@cinnamon (optional){1/4%tsp}, @ginger (optional){1/4%tsp}, @granulated sugar (optional){1%tsp}, @chia seeds (optional){1%tsp}).

Remove from heat and transfer to a clean #jar or container{} to cool thoroughly. Store in the fridge up to 1 week or freeze in ice cube molds up to 1 month. Reheat to serve with oats, pancakes, waffles, french toast, and more!
predict_cooklang:
Pantry:
  - fruit: 3 cups
  - orange juice: 3 Tbsp
  - cinnamon (optional): 0.25 tsp
  - ginger (optional): 0.25 tsp
  - granulated sugar (optional): 1 tsp
  - chia seeds (optional): 1 tsp

Recipe:
  1. Place fruit and orange juice in a small saucepan.
  2. Bring to medium heat.
  3. Reduce heat slightly and muddle/mash the fruit with a wooden spoon.
  4. Continue cooking over medium-low heat for 10-12 minutes, occasionally mashing fruit to combine.
  5. Turn off heat.
  6. Add optional add-ins (cinnamon, ginger, sugar, chia seeds).
  7. Transfer mixture to a clean jar or container to cool thoroughly.
  8. Store in the fridge up to 1 week or freeze in ice cube molds up to 1 month.
  9. Reheat to serve with oats, pancakes, waffles, french toast, and more!

name: Mayonnaise
ingredients: 1 large egg,4 tsp white wine vinegar,0.5 tsp Dijon mustard,0.75 tsp salt,0.25 tsp sugar,1.5 cups vegetable oil
method: Do not substitute olive oil for the vegetable oil; the mayonnaise will turn out bitter.  This recipe contains raw or undercooked eggs, which comes with inherent risks. To learn more about food safety,    check out this guide   . Process egg, vinegar, mustard, salt, and sugar in food processor until combined, about 5 seconds. With processor running, slowly drizzle in oil until emulsified and mixture is thick, about 2 minutes. Scrape down sides of bowl with rubber spatula and continue to process 5 seconds longer. Transfer to airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use. (Mayonnaise can be refrigerated for up to 1 week.) If you add the oil too quickly the emulsion will break and look like lumpy greasy salad dressingnot appealing. Add the oil slowly especially at first and your mayo will come together perfectly
cooklang:
Do not substitute olive oil for the vegetable oil; the mayonnaise will turn out bitter.

Process @egg{1%large}, @white wine vinegar{4%tsp}, @Dijon mustard{1/2%tsp}, @salt{3/4%tsp}, and @sugar{1/4%tsp} in #food processor{} until combined, about 5 seconds. With processor running, slowly drizzle in @vegetable oil{1.5%cups} until emulsified and mixture is thick, about 2 minutes. Scrape down sides of bowl with #rubber spatula{} and continue to process 5 seconds longer. Transfer to #airtight container{} and refrigerate until ready to use. (Mayonnaise can be refrigerated for up to 1 week.)
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
  - egg: 1
  - white wine vinegar: 4 tsp
  - Dijon mustard: 0.5 tsp
  - salt: 0.75 tsp
  - sugar: 0.25 tsp
  - vegetable oil: 1.5 cups

PROCESS:
  1. Combine egg, vinegar, mustard, salt, and sugar in food processor.
  2. Process until combined for about 5 seconds.
  3. With processor running, slowly drizzle in oil until emulsified and mixture is thick for about 2 minutes.
  4. Scrape down sides of bowl with rubber spatula.
  5. Continue to process for an additional 5 seconds.
  6. Transfer to airtight container.
  7. Refrigerate until ready to use.

WARNING:
  - Raw or undercooked eggs pose inherent risks; consult the provided guide for more information on food safety.
  - Do not substitute olive oil for vegetable oil, as it may result in bitter mayonnaise.
  - Add oil slowly, especially at first, to prevent emulsion breakdown and achieve a smooth consistency.

name: Single Jar of Fruit Jam
ingredients: 2 cup fruit,0.75 cup sugar,1 Tbsp lemon juice
method: Wash and cut the fruit. Wash and hull the fruit as needed. Cut large strawberries into quarters and peaches into bite-sized pieces. Combine the fruit with sugar and mash. Combine the fruit with the sugar and lemon juice in a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan. Gently mash with a wooden spoon until the fruit is juicy and most of the sugar is dissolved. Cook until jammy. Cook over a medium heat, continuing to mashing down on the fruit with a wooden spoon. Bring to a rolling boil and continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the jam is thick and darkened in color, about 20 minutes. Transfer the jam to a jar and refrigerate. Carefully spoon into a very clean (8-ounce) jar and let cool to room temperature. Seal the jar and refrigerate
cooklang:
This jam calls for just two cups of chopped fruit. This is about one pint of berries, four to six peaches or plums, or eight small apricots.

Wash and cut the @fruit{2%cup}. Wash and hull the fruit as needed. Cut large strawberries into quarters and peaches into bite-sized pieces.

Combine the fruit with @sugar{0.75%cup} and mash. Combine the fruit with the sugar and @lemon juice{1%Tbsp} in a #medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan{}. Gently mash with a #wooden spoon{} until the fruit is juicy and most of the sugar is dissolved.

Cook until jammy. Cook over a medium heat, continuing to mashing down on the fruit with a wooden spoon. Bring to a rolling boil and continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the jam is thick and darkened in color, about ~{20%minutes}.

Transfer the jam to an #8-oz jar{} and refrigerate. Carefully spoon into a very clean (8-ounce) jar and let cool to room temperature. Seal the jar and refrigerate.

  - cut: fruit (into quarters for strawberries and bite-sized pieces for peaches)
  - hull: fruit (as needed)

cook:
  - combine: fruit, sugar
  - mash: fruit with sugar
  - combine: fruit, sugar, lemon juice
  - cook: over medium heat
  - mash: down on the fruit with a wooden spoon
  - bring to boil: rolling boil
  - cook: until jammy (about 20 minutes)
  - stir: frequently

serve:
  - transfer: jam to a jar
  - refrigerate: jam in the jar
  - cool: to room temperature
  - seal: jar and refrigerate

name: Mixed Berry Coulis
ingredients: 2 cups frozen mixed berries,0.25 cups granulated sugar (optional),0.25 cup lemon juice (optional),2 Tbsp Chambord Liqueur or Grand Marnier (optional)
method: Place berries, sugar and lemon juice in a blender and purée until very smooth. Strain through a fine sieve (Chinois is best) into a glass bowl, pressing on solids to extract all the juice. Stir inChambord Liqueur or Grand Marnier, taste and adjust the sugar to your liking. NOTE:If it is too sour, add sugar. If it is too sweet add lemon juice.It all depends on the fruits you are using!

Defrost @frozen mixed berries{2%cups} in a strainer for ~{24%hours} so that the excess water drains into a bowl.

Place berries, @granulated sugar (optional){1/4%cups} and @lemon juice (optional){1/4%cup} in a #blender{} and purée until very smooth.

Mix in @Chambord Liqueur or Grand Marnier (optional){2%Tbsp}, taste and adjust the sugar to your liking.

Strain through a #fine sieve or chinois{} into a #glass bowl{}, pressing on solids to extract all the juice.

NOTE: If it is too sour, add sugar. If it is too sweet add lemon juice. It all depends on the fruits you are using!

do blend until very smooth
do strain through a fine sieve into a glass bowl, pressing on solids to extract all the juice
add 2 Tbsp Chambord Liqueur or Grand Marnier (optional) to the mixture
taste and adjust the sugar to your liking
if too sour, add sugar; if too sweet, add lemon juice

name: Dijon Mustard
ingredients: 2 Tbsp brown mustard seeds,4 Tbsp yellow mustard seeds,0.75 tsp salt,0.25 tsp white pepper,1 pinch all spice,1 Tbsp shallot or white or yellow onion,0.333 cup white wine vinegar,0.25 cup dry white wine
method: Add all dry ingredients together and mix: mustard seeds, salt, white pepper, all spice.  Add shallot / onion and mix.  Add white wine vinegar and mix.  Add white wine and mix.  Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 8 hours. Add mix to blender or food processor.  Blend until thickness and chunkiness desired.  Taste and add brown sugar if too bitter for your taste. Store in a small mason jar in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks to 2 months. See notes
cooklang:
Add all dry ingredients together and mix: @brown mustard seeds{2%Tbsp}, @yellow mustard seeds{4%Tbsp}, @salt{3/4%tsp}, @white pepper{1/4%tsp}, @all spice{1%pinch}. Add @shallot or white or yellow onion{1%Tbsp} and mix. Add @white wine vinegar{1/3%cup} and mix. Add @dry white wine{1/4%cup} and mix. Cover with #plastic wrap{} and refrigerate for at least 8 hours.

Add mix to #blender or food processor{}. Blend until thickness and chunkiness desired.

Store in a small mason jar in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks to 2 months. See notes.

You can omit the wine for water to remove any alcohol content for children or pregnancy.

This recipe makes spicy Dijon mustard. To adjust the heat, reduce the amount of brown mustard seeds.

- 0.25 cup dry white wine

Steps:
  - Add mustard seeds, salt, white pepper, and all spice together.

  - Add shallot / onion and mix.
  - Add white wine vinegar and mix.
  - Add dry white wine and mix.

name: Tzatziki Sauce
ingredients: 0.5  English cucumber,0.5 tsp salt,4 cloves garlic,1.5 cups full fat Greek yogurt,0.25 cup olive oil,0.5 tsp Aleppo chiles,0.5 tsp pepper,2 Tbsps dill,0.5  lemon juiced,some  white vinegar (optional)
method: Use the coarse side of a cheese grater to shred the peeled cucumber. Place grated cucumber in a bowl and season with 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Let it sit for 20-30 minutes. (This draws out the excess moisture.) Strain cucumber through a wire sieve, cheese cloth, or paper towel and place in a mixing bowl.Add all other ingredients and mix well. Taste and adjust any extra salt, vinegar, or lemon juice to your liking

Taste and adjust any extra salt, vinegar, or lemon juice to your liking.

name: Hollandaise
ingredients: 0.5 cup butter,3 large egg yolks,1 Tbsp lemon juice,0.125 tsp salt,1 dash cayenne pepper,some  parsley
method: Gather the ingredients. Melt the butter in a saucepan until it is hot and foaming, but do not let it brown. Keep it warm. Place a medium saucepan or bottom of a double boiler pan with about an inch of hot water over low heat and bring it to a simmer . In a stainless steel bowl or top pan of a double boiler, vigorously whisk the egg yolks with the lemon juice until the mixture is thickened. Place the bowl or pan over the simmering water and continue whisking. Drizzle the melted butter into the egg yolk mixture in a slow, steady stream while whisking. Continue whisking until the sauce has thickened. Take care not to let the bowl or top pan sit in the simmering water or you'll end up with scrambled eggs. And don't let the sauce get too hot or it could break. If it does start to look curdled, try whisking in a small amount of boilingwater a half-teaspoon at a time. Remove the sauce from the heat and whisk inthe salt and cayenne pepper or hot pepper sauce. The sauce is best served immediately, but if it must be held, place the bowl in a pan with hot water or put it in the top of a double boiler over hot water. Keep it on very low heat. Too long or too hot and the sauce will break. If the sauce becomes too thick on standing, whisk in a small amount of hot water to thin it. Enjoy
cooklang:
Gather the ingredients.

Melt the @butter{0.5%cup} in a saucepan until it is hot and foaming, but do not let it brown. Keep it warm.

Place a #medium saucepan{} or bottom of a double boiler pan with about an inch of hot water over low heat and bring it to a simmer.

In a stainless steel bowl or top pan of a double boiler, vigorously whisk the @egg yolks{3%large} with the @lemon juice{1%Tbsp} until the mixture is thickened.

Place the bowl or pan over the simmering water and continue whisking.

Drizzle the melted butter into the egg yolk mixture in a slow, steady stream while whisking. Continue whisking until the sauce has thickened. Take care not to let the bowl or top pan sit in the simmering water or you'll end up with scrambled eggs. And don't let the sauce get too hot or it could break. If it does start to look curdled, try whisking in a small amount of boiling water a half-teaspoon at a time.

Remove the sauce from the heat and whisk in the @salt{0.125%tsp} and @cayenne pepper{1%dash} or hot pepper sauce.

The sauce is best served immediately, but if it must be held, place the bowl in a pan with hot water or put it in the top of a double boiler over hot water. Keep it on very low heat. Too long or too hot and the sauce will break.

If the sauce becomes too thick on standing, whisk in a small amount of hot water to thin it.

Top with finely chopped @parsley{} and enjoy.
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
  - butter: 0.5 cup
  - egg yolks: 3 large
  - lemon juice: 1 Tbsp
  - salt: 0.125 tsp
  - cayenne pepper: 1 dash
  - parsley: some

RECIPE:
GATHER INGREDIENTS.
HEAT butter in a saucepan until hot and foaming, but do not let it brown. KEEP IT WARM.
PLACE a medium saucepan or bottom of a double boiler pan with about an inch of hot water over low heat and bring it to a simmer .
WHISK egg yolks with lemon juice in a stainless steel bowl or top pan of a double boiler until the mixture is thickened.
PLACE the bowl or pan over the simmering water and continue whisking.
DRIZZLE melted butter into the egg yolk mixture in a slow, steady stream while whisking. CONTINUE WHISKING until the sauce has thickened.
TAKE CARE not to let the bowl or top pan sit in the simmering water or you'll end up with scrambled eggs.
IF the sauce starts to look curdled, try whisking in a small amount of boiling water a half-teaspoon at a time.
REMOVE the sauce from the heat and WHISK IN the salt and cayenne pepper or hot pepper sauce.
SERVE immediately. IF it must be held, place the bowl in a pan with hot water or put it in the top of a double boiler over hot water. KEEP IT ON VERY LOW HEAT.
IF the sauce becomes too thick on standing, WHISK IN a small amount of hot water to thin it.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup bread flour,0.75 cup all-purpose flour,0.5 tsp table salt,1 tsp baking soda,1 cup unsalted butter,2 tbsp water,1 cup dark brown sugar,0.5 cup white sugar,2 tsp vanilla,1  egg,1  egg yolk,0.5 cup milk chocolate chips,5 oz milk chocolate bar, chopped
method: In a medium bowl, sift together the flours, salt, and baking soda. Set aside. In a medium or large saucepan, add the butter and melt over medium heat. The larger the pan you use, the quicker the process will be! Bring the butter to a boil, stirring frequently. As the water begins to boil out of the butter, the milk solids in the butter will separate, sink to the bottom, and begin to toast and brown. As this begins to happen, make sure to stir constantly so the butter browns evenly. It may become quite foamy, splatter a bit, and be difficult to see, so keep a close eye on it, removing from heat and continuing to stir if it starts to foam over. Once the butter has turned a nice nutty brown, remove from the heat and pour into a large liquid measuring cup to stop the cooking. Allow it to cool down for a minute or two, give it a stir, and carefully add 2-3 tablespoons of water to the butter to bring it back up to 1 cup (240 ml) of liquid. Set aside to cool to room temperature. To help speed this process up, you can place in the fridge for 10-15 minutes. You want to make sure the butter is still liquid when you’re adding it to the dough later on, so make sure to remove after 15 minutes. In a large bowl, add the sugars, vanilla, espresso powder, and cooled brown butter. Cream together with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy, 1-2 minutes. Add the egg and yolk and beat until incorporated. Add the dry ingredients, about ⅓ of the mixture at a time, and beat between additions until just incorporated. It’s okay for there to be a bit of unmixed flour on the edge of bowl, this will be incorporated in the next step. Using a wooden spoon, fold the chocolate chips and chunks into the dough Scoop the cookies onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet in 3-tablespoon-sized mounds. For optimal flavor, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or, even better, overnight. Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C). Evenly space the dough 3 inches (8 cm) apart from one another on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Bake in a preheated oven for 12-14 minutes. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2-3 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely. Enjoy!
cooklang:
In a #medium bowl{}, sift together the @bread flour{1%cup}, @all-purpose flour{3/4%cup}, @table salt{1/2%tsp}, and @baking soda{1%tsp}. Set aside.

In a #medium or large saucepan{}, add the @unsalted butter{1%cup} and melt over medium heat. [- The larger the pan you use, the quicker the process will be! -]

Bring the butter to a boil, stirring frequently. As the water begins to boil out of the butter, the milk solids in the butter will separate, sink to the bottom, and begin to toast and brown. As this begins to happen, make sure to stir constantly so the butter browns evenly. It may become quite foamy, splatter a bit, and be difficult to see, so keep a close eye on it, removing from heat and continuing to stir if it starts to foam over.

Once the butter has turned a nice nutty brown, remove from the heat and pour into a #large liquid measuring cup{} to stop the cooking. Allow it to cool down for a minute or two, give it a stir, and carefully add @water{2%tbsp} to the butter to bring it back up to 1 cup (240 ml) of liquid.

Set aside to cool to room temperature. To help speed this process up, you can place in the fridge for ~{10%minutes}. You want to make sure the butter is still liquid when you're adding it to the dough later on.

In the bowl of a #stand mixer{}, add @dark brown sugar{1%cup}, @white sugar{1/2%cup}, @vanilla{2%tsp}, and cooled brown butter from before. Cream together until light and fluffy, ~{2%minutes}.

Add the @egg{1} and @egg yolk{1} and beat until incorporated.

Add the contents from the medium bowl (from step 1), about ⅓ at a time, and beat until just incorporated.

Add in @milk chocolate chips{1/2%cup} and @milk chocolate bar, chopped{5%oz} into the dough. Use a rubber spatula to get the flour and splattered dough back into the mix.

Scoop the cookies onto a #parchment paper{}-lined #baking sheet{} in 3-tablespoon-sized mounds, evenly spaced 3 inches (8 cm) apart from one another. Cover and refrigerate for ~{1%hour}. [- For optimal flavor, refrigerate overnight -]

Preheat the oven to 350˚F

Bake in a preheated oven for 12-14 minutes

Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for ~{3%minutes}
predict_cooklang:

- 1 egg yolk

- 5 oz milk chocolate bar, chopped

RECIPE

- can place in fridge for 10-15 minutes to speed up process

name: Fluffiest Pancakes
ingredients: 2.5 cup all-purpose flour,3 tbsp sugar,2 tsp kosher salt,1 tsp baking powder,1 tsp baking soda,2.5 cup buttermilk,8 tbsp melted butter,2  egg yolks,2  egg whites,some  chocolate chips,some  small fruit,some  butter,some  maple syrup
method: In a large bowl, add the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda and whisk to combine. In a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, add the buttermilk, melted butter, and egg yolks and whisk to combine. Add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients and gently fold with a rubber spatula until just combined. Add the egg whites and fold until just combined. Be sure not to overmix. Some lumps are okay. Let the batter rest for 15-30 minutes at room temperature. Add the butter to a cast iron skillet and heat over medium low heat. Once the butter has melted and is bubbling, reduce the heat to medium-low and add ⅓ cup (75 g) of batter to the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until bubbles start to appear on the surface. If adding any toppings like chocolate chips or blueberries, sprinkle over the pancake. Flip the pancake over and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter. Serve the pancakes with butter and maple syrup. Enjoy!
cooklang:
In a large bowl, add the @all-purpose flour{2.5%cup}, @sugar{3%tbsp}, @kosher salt{2%tsp}, @baking powder{1%tsp}, and @baking soda{1%tsp} and whisk to combine.

In a medium bowl or #liquid measuring cup{}, add the @buttermilk{2.5%cup}, @melted butter{8%tbsp}, and @egg yolks{2} and whisk to combine.

Add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients and gently fold with a rubber spatula until just combined.

Add the @egg whites{2} and fold until just combined. Be sure not to overmix. Some lumps are okay.

Let the batter rest for ~{30%minutes} at room temperature.

Add oil to #small pan{} and heat over medium low heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add ⅓ cup (75 g) of batter to the pan.

Cook for ~{3%minutes}, until bubbles start to appear on the surface. If adding any toppings like @chocolate chips{} or @small fruit{} [- Small fruit includes (but not limited to) blueberries, raspberries, blackberry, etc -], sprinkle over the pancake. Flip the pancake over and cook for another ~{2%minutes}, until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter.

Serve the pancakes with @butter{} and @maple syrup{}.

FLIP the pancake over and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until golden brown.
REPEAT with the remaining batter.
SERVE the pancakes with butter and maple syrup.

name: Melt in Your Mouth Chicken
ingredients: 4  boneless, skinless chicken breasts,some  buttermilk,0.5 cup mayonnaise,0.5 cup Greek yogurt,0.5 cup parmesan cheese,1 tsp seasoning salt,0.5 tsp black pepper,1 tsp garlic powder,0.5 cup parmesan cheese
method: Cut each chicken breast into 3 large chunks or strips.  Place chicken breast strips/chunks in a bowl of milk/buttermilk. Let it soak for 20 -30 min or overnight. Preheat oven to 375 F.  In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese and seasonings. Place chicken into a 9x13 baking dish and spread the mixture evenly on top of the chicken breasts, and sprinkle with remain parmesan. Bake for about 40-45 minutes, or until cooked through. You can also finish them off under the broiler for a minute or two to get them extra browned on top. Serve with a veggie like these delicious fresh broccoli that I steamed. Season with a dash of fresh parsley, if desired
cooklang:
Cut each @boneless, skinless chicken breasts{4} [- Be sure to trim excess fat from chicken breasts -] into 3 large chunks or strips. Place chicken breast strips/chunks in a #bowl of @buttermilk{}. Let it soak for 20 -30 min or overnight.

Preheat #oven to 375 F. In a small bowl, combine the @mayonnaise{1/2%cup}, @Greek yogurt{1/2%cup}, @parmesan cheese{1/2%cup}, @seasoning salt{1%tsp}, @black pepper{1/2%tsp}, and @garlic powder{1%tsp}.

Place chicken into a #9x13 baking dish{} and spread the mixture evenly on top of the chicken breasts, and sprinkle with @parmesan cheese{1/2%cup}.

Bake for about ~{45%minutes}, or until cooked through. You can also finish them off under the broiler for a minute or two to get them extra browned on top.
predict_cooklang:

  - boneless, skinless chicken breasts
  - buttermilk
  - mayonnaise
  - Greek yogurt
  - parmesan cheese
  - seasoning salt
  - black pepper
  - garlic powder

RECIPE:
PREP_TIME: 20-30 minutes (or overnight)
COOK_TIME: 40-45 minutes
TOTAL_TIME: 60-75 minutes

STEP 1:
CHOP chicken breasts into 3 large chunks or strips.

STEP 2:
SOAK chicken breast strips/chunks in a bowl of milk/buttermilk for 20-30 min or overnight.

STEP 3:
PREHEAT oven to 375 F.

STEP 4:
COMBINE mayonnaise, 0.5 cup parmesan cheese, and seasonings in a small bowl.

STEP 5:
PLACE chicken breast strips/chunks into a 9x13 baking dish and spread the mixture evenly on top of the chicken breasts.

STEP 6:
SPRINKLE remaining parmesan cheese on top of the chicken breasts.

STEP 7:
BAKE for about 40-45 minutes, or until cooked through.

STEP 8:
OPTIONAL: FINISH under the broiler for a minute or two to get them extra browned on top.

STEP 9:
SERVE with steamed broccoli and garnish with fresh parsley if desired.

name: Panda Express Orange Chicken
ingredients: 2 lb chicken,1 tbsp salt,1 tsp white pepper,1 cup cornstarch,3 cup flour,1  egg,1.5 cup water,2 tbsp oil
method: On a cutting board, cut chicken into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes and set aside. In a medium mixing bowl, combine salt, white pepper, cornstarch, and flour. Whisk to combine. Add the egg, water, and oil until it reaches the consistency of pancake batter. Add the chicken to the batter and refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Heat oil in a wok or heavy bottom pan to 350˚F (180˚C). Gently add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes until lightly golden brown. Remove the chicken from the pan and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Set a heavy bottomed pot over medium- high heat and add the oil. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the red pepper flakes, ginger, and garlic, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly. Add the sugar and brown sugar, and stir to combine. Add in the orange juice and allow the sugars to begin to dissolve in the liquid, stirring occasionally. Add in the vinegar and soy sauce, and stir to combine. Add the cornstarch and water together and whisk to combine. Add to the pan and stir. Continue to cook the sauce until maple syrup consistency is achieved. Add in the fried chicken and stir until completely coated in the sauce. Top with sesame oil. Enjoy!
cooklang:
On a #cutting board{}, cut @chicken{2%lb} into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes and set aside.

In a #medium mixing bowl{}, combine @salt{1%tbsp}, @white pepper{1%tsp}, @cornstarch{1%cup}, and @flour{3%cup}. Whisk to combine.

Add the @egg{1}, @water{3/2%cup}, and @oil{2%tbsp} until it reaches the consistency of pancake batter.

Add the chicken to the batter and refrigerate at least ~{30%minutes}.

Heat oil in a wok or #heavy bottom pan{} to 350˚F (180˚C).

Gently add the chicken and cook for ~{5%minutes} or until lightly golden brown.

Remove the chicken from the pan and transfer to a #paper towel-lined plate{}.

  WHISK to combine.

STEP 6:

  REMOVE from the pan and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

  TOP with sesame oil.

name: Venezuelan Beef Liver and Onions
ingredients: 2 tbsp oil,3  garlic cloves,1.5 lb liver strips,some  salt,some  pepper,1 tbsp oil,1 tbsp butter,3  sliced onions,0.5 cup white wine,2 tbsp flour,2 cup beef stock
method: To reduce the strong taste of the meat place liver in a bowl, or a Ziploc bag, and cover with milk, or buttermilk, and refrigerate. Let it soak up to 2 hours. Then remove the liver from the liquid and pat dry. This step is optional but highlyrecommended If you are not used to the taste of the liver. Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of oil. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, stirring constantly to avoid burning, about 1 - 2 minutes. Add the liver strips, working in batches if necessary, and fry until browned on both sides. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook liver until reaches an internal temperature of 160°F.Remove the liver from the skillet with a slotted spoon. Set aside on a plate or bowl. Add the remaining tablespoon of oil and the butter to the same skillet. Add onions and sauté until translucent and fragrant. Add the liver back to the skillet and add the wine. Let the wine reduce for 2 - 3 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve hot with rice, mashed potatoes or veggies
cooklang:
Heat a #large cast-iron skillet{} over medium-high heat. Add @oil{2%tbsp}. Add @garlic cloves{3} and sauté until fragrant, stirring constantly to avoid burning, about ~{2%minutes}.

Add the @liver strips{1.5%lb}, working in batches if necessary, and fry until browned on both sides. Season with @salt{} and @pepper{} to taste [- To add more flavor season the liver with cumin and/or paprika. You can also add cayenne pepper if you like the heat. -]. Cook liver until reaches an internal temperature of 160 F. Remove the liver from the skillet with a slotted spoon. Set aside on a plate or bowl.

Add @oil{1%tbsp} and the @butter{1%tbsp} to the same skillet. Add @sliced onions{3} and sauté until translucent and fragrant. Add the liver back to the skillet and add @white wine{0.5%cup}. Let the wine reduce for ~{3%minutes}.

Use the pan drippings to make a gravy. Just add @flour{2%tbsp} per batch [- Refering to batch of liver cooked -] to the drippings. Cook the flour briefly for ~{1.5%minutes}, stirring constantly, then add @beef stock{2%cup} per batch. Cook and stir until thickened. Serve over liver and onions.

Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve hot with rice, mashed potatoes or veggies.
predict_cooklang:
Soak liver in milk or buttermilk for up to 2 hours, then pat dry
Heat oil in cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant (1-2 minutes)
Add liver strips and fry until browned on both sides
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Cook liver until reaches internal temperature of 160°F
Remove liver from skillet and set aside
Heat oil and butter in same skillet over medium heat
Add onions and sauté until translucent and fragrant
Add liver back to skillet and add wine
Let wine reduce for 2-3 minutes
Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve hot

name: Loaded Twice Baked Potatoes
ingredients: 4  large potatoes,some  olive oil,some  foil,4 tbsp unsalted butter,0.333 cup sour cream,0.333 cup milk,0.5 tsp salt,0.5 tsp garlic powder,0.25 tsp pepper,0.25 tsp paprika,0.25 tsp onion powder,0.667 cup cheddar cheese,3 tbsp crumbled bacon,0.333 cup cheddar cheese,3 tbsp crumbled bacon,2 tbsp chives
method: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Wrap potatoes in foil or rub with a bit of vegetable oil, prick with a fork, and place on a lined baking sheet. Place in the oven and bake for 1 hour, or until fork-tender. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350°F (175°C). Using a knife, cut each potato in half lengthwise. Spoon out the inside of the potatoes into a large mixing bowl, taking care not to break the skin. Leave a thin lining of potato for support. Return the potato skins to the baking sheet. In the large mixing bowl, add the butter, sour cream, milk, salt, garlic powder, pepper, paprika, onion powder, 2/3 cup cheddar cheese, and 3 slices of crumbled bacon. Mash and mix until combined but still slightly chunky. Scoop filling into the shells, and top each potato with the remaining cheese. Place in the oven and bake for 20–25 minutes, or until the cheese is melty. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the reserved bacon and the chives. Enjoy immediately
cooklang:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

Rub @large potatoes{4} with a little bit of @olive oil{} and wrap in @foil{}, prick with a fork and place on a lined baking sheet. Place in the oven and bake for ~{1%hour} or until tender.

Remove from the oven and allow to cool for ~{10%minutes}. Reduce oven to 350 degrees.

Using a knife, cut each potato in half lengthwise. Spoon out the inside of the potatoes into a #large mixing bowl{}, taking care not to break the skin. Leave a thin lining of potato for support. Return the potato skins to the baking sheet.

In the large mixing bowl, add the @unsalted butter{4%tbsp}, @sour cream{1/3%cup}, @milk{1/3%cup}, @salt{1/2%tsp}, @garlic powder{1/2%tsp}, @pepper{1/4%tsp}, @paprika{1/4%tsp}, @onion powder{1/4%tsp}, @cheddar cheese{2/3%cup} and @crumbled bacon{3%tbsp}. Mash and mix until combined, but still slightly chunky. Scoop filling into the shells, top each potato with @cheddar cheese{1/3%cup}.

Place in the oven and bake for ~{25%minutes} or until the cheese is melty. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with @crumbled bacon{3%tbsp} and the @chives{2%tbsp}.

REMOVE potatoes from oven and ALLOW to cool for 10 minutes.

PLACE potatoes in oven and BAKE for 20–25 minutes, or until cheese is melty.
REMOVE potatoes from oven.

name: Guy Fieri Spicy Sriracha Mayonnaise
ingredients: 1 cup mayonnaise,0.5 cup sour cream,1.5 tbsp sriracha,1 tsp lemon juice,1 tsp honey,4  finely chopped green onions,some  salt,some  pepper
method: In a mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, Sriracha, Lemon Juice, Honey and green onions. Stir until well combined. Add salt and pepper to taste. Let the sauce sit for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator. This will allow all the flavors to meld. You can use it immediately, but the longer you let it sit in the refrigerator, the more flavorful it will be
cooklang:
In a #mixing bowl{}, combine the @mayonnaise{1%cup}, @sour cream{1/2%cup}, @sriracha{1.5%tbsp}, @lemon juice{1%tsp}, @honey{1%tsp} and @finely chopped green onions{4}. Stir until well combined. Add @salt{} and @pepper{} to taste.

Let the sauce sit for at least ~{1%hour} in the refrigerator. This will allow all the flavors to meld. You can use it immediately, but the longer you let it sit in the refrigerator, the more flavorful it will be.

COMBINE mayonnaise, sour cream, sriracha, lemon juice, honey, and green onions in a mixing bowl.

name: Guy Fieri Donkey Sauce
ingredients: 3.2 tbsp mayonnaise,1 tbsp roasted garlic,0.2 tsp mustard,0.025 tsp Worcestershire,0.05 tsp salt,0.025 tsp pepper
method: In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, roasted garlic, mustard, Worcestershire, salt and pepper and mix until smooth. Spoon a generous amount on each burger and enjoy!
cooklang: In a #small bowl{}, combine the @mayonnaise{3.2%tbsp}, @roasted garlic{1%tbsp}, @mustard{1/5%tsp} [- Yellow mustard can be substituted with spicy mustard -], @Worcestershire{1/40%tsp}, @salt{1/20%tsp} and @pepper{1/40%tsp} and mix until smooth.

name: Panda Express Orange Sauce
ingredients: 1 tbsp oil,0.25 tsp red pepper flakes,0.5 tsp ginger, minced,1 tbsp garlic, minced,0.25 cup sugar,0.25 cup brown sugar,0.25 cup orange juice,0.25 cup white distilled vinegar,2 tbsp soy sauce,2 tbsp cornstarch,2 tbsp water,1 tsp sesame oil
method: On a cutting board, cut chicken into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes and set aside. In a medium mixing bowl, combine salt, white pepper, cornstarch, and flour. Whisk to combine. Add the egg, water, and oil until it reaches the consistency of pancake batter. Add the chicken to the batter and refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Heat oil in a wok or heavy bottom pan to 350˚F (180˚C). Gently add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes until lightly golden brown. Remove the chicken from the pan and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Set a heavy bottomed pot over medium- high heat and add the oil. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the red pepper flakes, ginger, and garlic, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly. Add the sugar and brown sugar, and stir to combine. Add in the orange juice and allow the sugars to begin to dissolve in the liquid, stirring occasionally. Add in the vinegar and soy sauce, and stir to combine. Add the cornstarch and water together and whisk to combine. Add to the pan and stir. Continue to cook the sauce until maple syrup consistency is achieved. Add in the fried chicken and stir until completely coated in the sauce. Top with sesame oil. Enjoy!
cooklang:
Set a #heavy bottomed pot{} over medium - high heat and add the @oil{1%tbsp}.

Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the @red pepper flakes{1/4%tsp}, @ginger, minced{1/2%tsp}, and @garlic, minced{1%tbsp}, and cook for ~{30%seconds}, stirring constantly.

Add the @sugar{1/4%cup} and @brown sugar{1/4%cup}, and stir to combine.

Add in the @orange juice{1/4%cup} and allow the sugars to begin to dissolve in the liquid, stirring occasionally.

Add in the @white distilled vinegar{1/4%cup} and @soy sauce{2%tbsp}, and stir to combine.

Add the @cornstarch{2%tbsp} and @water{2%tbsp} together and whisk to combine. Add to the pan and stir.

Continue to cook the sauce until maple syrup consistency is achieved.

Add in the fried chicken and stir until completely coated in the sauce.

Top with @sesame oil{1%tsp}.
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
- oil: 1 tbsp
- red pepper flakes: 0.25 tsp
- ginger: 0.5 tsp (minced)
- garlic: 1 tbsp (minced)
- sugar: 0.25 cup
- brown sugar: 0.25 cup
- orange juice: 0.25 cup
- white distilled vinegar: 0.25 cup
- soy sauce: 2 tbsp
- cornstarch: 2 tbsp
- water: 2 tbsp
- sesame oil: 1 tsp

RECIPE:
PREPARE CHICKEN BY CUTTING INTO 1X1-INCH (2X2-CM) CUBES AND SET ASIDE.
COMBINE SALT, WHITE PEPPER, CORNSTARCH, AND FLOUR IN A MEDIUM MIXING BOWL. WHISK TO COMBINE.
ADD EGG, WATER, AND OIL TO THE BATTER UNTIL IT REACHES PANCAKE BATTER CONSISTENCY. ADD CHICKEN TO THE BATTER AND REFRIGERATE FOR AT LEAST 30 MINUTES.
HEAT OIL IN A WOK OR HEAVY BOTTOMED PAN TO 350˚F (180˚C). GENTLY ADD CHICKEN AND COOK FOR 5-6 MINUTES UNTIL LIGHTLY GOLDEN BROWN. REMOVE FROM THE PAN AND TRANSFER TO A PAPER TOWEL-LINED PLATE.
SET A HEAVY BOTTOMED POT OVER MEDIUM-HIGH HEAT AND ADD OIL. ONCE IT SHimmers, ADD RED PEPPER FLAKES, GINGER, AND GARLIC. COOK FOR 30 SECONDS, STIRRING CONSTANTLY.
ADD SUGAR AND BROWN SUGAR TO THE PAN AND STIR TO COMBINE. ADD ORANGE JUICE AND ALLOW SUGARS TO BEGIN DISSOLVING IN THE LIQUID, STIRRING OCCASIONALLY.
ADD VINEGAR AND SOY SAUCE TO THE PAN AND STIR TO COMBINE. WHISK CORNSTARCH AND WATER TOGETHER AND ADD TO THE PAN. STIR CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL MAPLE SYRUP CONSISTENCY IS ACHIEVED.
ADD FRIED CHICKEN TO THE SAUCE AND STIR UNTIL COMPLETELY COATED. TOP WITH SESAME OIL.

name: Buffalo Chicken Sandwich
ingredients: 3  chicken breast,6  hamburger buns,1.5 cup buttermilk,1 tbsp Tapatío hot sauce,some  cooking oil,1.5 cup flour,0.5 tsp salt,1 tsp cajun seasoning,6 tbsp butter,6 tbsp Frank's hot sauce,some  ranch dressing,6 tsp mayonnaise
method: Gather the ingredients. Begin by brining the chicken. Mix the buttermilk and 1 tablespoonof the Frank's hot sauce in a ziplock bag. Add the chicken and refrigerate up to 2 days. When ready to cook heat peanut or vegetable oil to 360 F. Meanwhile, in a shallow dish, mix flour, salt, and paprika together. Remove the chicken from the buttermilk mixture and let excess liquid fall off. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture, then back in the buttermilk, then back in the flour. Add the chicken to the heated oil and fry until cooked through and golden brown, about five minutes, flipping halfway through. Remove from the heat and set on a paper towel. Sprinkle with a little bit of salt and set aside. To make the buffalo sauce, use a small saucepan. Melt the butter and stir in the reamaining Frank's hot sauce. Meanwhile, toast the buns by adding a bit of extra butter to a small frying pan and toast the interior of the bun until it's golden and crispy. Set aside. Smear both sides of the bun with some ranch dressing. Once the chicken has fried, toss it in the buffalo sauce and place it in the sandwich. Top with arugula and crumbled blue cheese. Serve immediately
cooklang:
Cut @chicken breast{3} into sizes that will fit on @hamburger buns{6}. Then slice [- Slicing makes the chicken more tender than pounding -] chicken horizontally to make them thinner [- Aim for 1/2 inch thickness -]

Mix the @buttermilk{3/2%cup} and @Tapatío hot sauce{1%tbsp} [- Replace Tapatío with Frank's for a sweeter outcome -] in a #medium bowl{}. Add the chicken, cover, and refrigerate at least ~{10%hours} (overnight).

When ready to cook @cooking oil{} to 360 F. Meanwhile, in a #medium bowl{}, mix @flour{3/2%cup}, @salt{1/2%tsp}, and @cajun seasoning{1%tsp} [- Replace cajun seasoning with cayenne pepper or paprika for a sweeter outcome -] together.

Remove the chicken from the buttermilk mixture and let excess liquid fall off. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture, then back in the buttermilk, then back in the flour.

Add the chicken to the heated oil and fry until cooked through and golden brown, about five minutes, flipping halfway through. Remove from the heat and set on a #paper towel{}.

To make the buffalo sauce, use a #medium saucepan{}. Melt the @butter{6%tbsp} and stir in @Frank's hot sauce{6%tbsp}.

Meanwhile, toast the buns in the toaster [- Don't forget to set toaster to bagel mode -] until the interior of the bun is golden and crispy. Set aside.

Smear both sides of the bun with some @ranch dressing{} [- Enough ranch fully cover the bun but not enough to pour off -]. Once the chicken has fried, toss it in the buffalo sauce and place it in the sandwich.

Top with @mayonnaise{6%tsp} [- About 1tsp per sandwich, place mayo in tiny chunks since spreading is impossible due to buffalo sauce -]. Serve immediately.
predict_cooklang:
step Brine the chicken:
  - mix buttermilk with Frank's hot sauce
  - add chicken to mixture and refrigerate

step Fry the chicken:
  - heat oil to 360 F
  - mix flour, salt, and paprika together
  - dip chicken in flour mixture, then back in buttermilk, then back in flour
  - fry chicken until cooked through and golden brown

step Make buffalo sauce:
  - melt butter in a small saucepan
  - stir in remaining Frank's hot sauce

step Toast the buns:
  - add extra butter to a small frying pan
  - toast interior of bun until golden and crispy

step Assemble the sandwich:
  - smear ranch dressing on both sides of the bun
  - toss fried chicken in buffalo sauce
  - place chicken in sandwich
  - top with arugula and crumbled blue cheese

name: Tuscan Chicken Pasta
ingredients: 2 lb, cubed  chicken breast,some  olive oil,lots  garlic,1, diced  onion,some  sundried tomatoes,more than you think  spinach,some  heavy cream,some  parmesan cheese,some  salt,some  pepper,some  pasta
method: Season the chicken tenders with salt and pepper on both sides. Fill a large cast-iron skillet with the olive oil and cook both sides of the seasoned tenders over medium-high heat. Now set them aside to cool, then dice them up into cubes. Now make the sauce by sautéing the butter, minced garlic, sun-dried tomatoes (oil drained) and spinach over medium heat. Once the spinach has wilted, add the cream and let it come to a simmer. Now remove from heat and add the salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and grated Parmesan cheese. Then add your cooked hot penne pasta and cubes chicken back in. Give it a quick stir and serve
cooklang:
Cook the @chicken breast{2 lb, cubed} in a skillet with @olive oil{} and your favorite pasta Italianish seasonings.

Saute the @garlic{lots}, @onion{1, diced}, @sundried tomatoes{}, and @spinach{more than you think}. 

Reduce the heat and add the @heavy cream{} followed by the @parmesan cheese{}.

Let the sauce thicken to your preference and season with @salt and @pepper{}.

Add the chicken to the sauce and serve over @pasta{}.
predict_cooklang:
Recipe: Chicken Pasta Bake
Ingredients:
- 2 lb cubed chicken breast
- some olive oil
- lots garlic
- 1 diced onion
- some sundried tomatoes
- more than you think spinach
- some heavy cream
- some parmesan cheese
- some salt
- some pepper
- some pasta

Instructions:
- Season the chicken with salt and pepper on both sides.
- Fill a large cast-iron skillet with olive oil and cook the seasoned chicken over medium-high heat. Set aside to cool, then dice into cubes.
- Sauté butter, minced garlic, sun-dried tomatoes (oil drained), and spinach over medium heat until the spinach has wilted.
- Add heavy cream and let it come to a simmer. Remove from heat and add salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and grated parmesan cheese.
- Add cooked hot penne pasta and cubed chicken back into the sauce. Give it a quick stir and serve.

name: French Toast
ingredients: 1  egg,1/4 cup  milk,1/2 t  cinnamon,some  nutmeg,some  ginger,1 t  vanilla,4 slices  bread
method: To make this easy French toast recipe: Whisk egg, vanilla and cinnamon in shallow dish. Stir in milk.  Dip bread slices in egg mixture, turning to coat evenly on both sides.  Cook bread slices on lightly greased nonstick griddle or skillet on medium heat until cooked through and browned on both sides. Serve with Easy Spiced Syrup (recipe follows), if desired. Voila, easy French toast.  Easy Spiced Syrup:  Add 1 teaspoon McCormick® Pure Vanilla Extract and 1/4 teaspoon McCormick® Ground Cinnamon to 1 cup pancake syrup; stir well to mix. Serve warm, if desired
cooklang:
Mix the @egg{1}, @milk{1/4 cup}, @cinnamon{1/2 t}, @nutmeg{}, @ginger{}, and @vanilla{1 t} in a #small bowl{}.

Dip the @bread{4 slices} one slice at a time in the mixture until fully coated. 

Cook in a #frying pan{} over medium heat until tasty lookin.

Enjoy!
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
  - egg
  - milk
  - cinnamon
  - nutmeg
  - ginger
  - vanilla
  - bread

name: kakuni
ingredients: 450 g pork belly,some  oil,1 knob ginger,2  green onions,some  water,3  eggs,some  dashi,some  sake,some  mirin,some  sugar,some  soy sauce,some  red chili pepper
method: Gather all the ingredients. I made quick dashi using a dashi packet (it only takes 3 minutes). Leave the eggs in the refrigerator until ready to use. Cut 1 Tokyo negi (naga negi; long green onion) in half to separate the green and white parts. Cut the green part into 2-inch (5-cm) pieces. Set aside the white part to make Shiraga Negi later for garnish (see how in To Serve below). Cut 1 knob ginger (unpeeled) into thin slices. Divide; set aside half for slow-cooking the pork and the other half for braising. Cut 1⅔ lb pork belly strips into shorter blocks that will lie straight when placed in a large pot later (I use a 4 QT Staub). If your pork belly is already in smaller blocks, you don't need to cut it. To sear, heat a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. When it‘s hot, add ½ Tbsp neutral oil. Tip: Using the oil helps render the pork's fat faster. Place the pork belly fat side down in the hot skillet. (Do not overcrowd the pot. Sear in batches if you're doubling the recipe.) To prevent oil splatter, you can use a splatter screen. Tip: Searing the surface of the meat before boiling helps draw out excess fat and lock in the flavor. Sear the meat until all sides are nicely browned, about 2–3 minutes per side. Transfer the seared pork belly pieces to the large, heavy-bottomed pot. Lay them straight and in a single layer. To the pot, add ¼ cup sake and enough water to cover the meat. To start off, I added 1.5 QT or 1.5 L water for a single batch of the recipe; however, if there's enough room in your pot, add 2 QT or 2 L of water. Add the green part of the negi and half of the sliced ginger (save the other half for braising later). Bring it to a boil over medium heat. Tip: Boiling the meat removes the excess fat and scum while keeping the meat juicy. Skim the scum and fat with a fine-mesh skimmer, and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Place an otoshibuta (drop lid) directly on top of the pork belly. You can buy an otoshibuta on Amazon or make one with aluminum foil following my post on How To Make Otoshibuta. Cook, uncovered, on a *gentle simmer*, for 3 hours. Leave off the pot lid so the unwanted odor goes away. Tip: I cannot emphasize enough that slow, gentle cooking is the key. If you cook on strong heat, the meat will become tough. When the liquid is running low, add more water or hot water (I added another 0.5 QT or 0.5 L) to the pot so the meat remains submerged at all times. Tip: Make sure the meat is not exposed, or else it will become dry. Meanwhile, boil enough water in a medium saucepan so the eggs will be completely submerged when added. Remove 4 large eggs (50 g each w/o shell) from the refrigerator. Gently lower the cold eggs into the boiling water using a fine-mesh skimmer. Set a timer for 6½–7 minutes and soft-boil them on medium-low heat. As soon as the timer is up, transfer the eggs to a bowl of iced water to stop the cooking. Let them cool, peel them, and set aside. Bring a small amount of water in the same pot to a boil. Remove the tough strings from 5 snap peas and add them to the boiling water. Blanch them until tender, about 1½–2 minutes. Set aside until ready to serve. After cooking for 3 hours, remove the otoshibuta (drop lid) and check the meat for tenderness. Tip: For really tender pork belly, cook for at least 3 hours and add more water as needed to keep the meat fully submerged. Remove the pork belly to a tray or plate. If you'd like, you can strain and reserve the cooking liquid as a stock for other recipes. Let the liquid sit in the fridge and skim off any fat that floats to the top before using. Gently cut the pork belly into 2-inch (2.5-cm) pieces. The pork should be very tender by now, so handle carefully. Place the pieces in a single layer in a medium, heavy-bottomed pot (I use a 2.75 QT Staub). Tip: Use a medium pot for a tighter fit so the seasonings will completely cover the meat. If you use the same large pot as before, you may need to increase the amount of seasonings to cover the meat. Cut 1 dried red chili pepper (optional) in half and discard the seeds. If you like it spicy, you can include the seeds. Add 2½ cups dashi (Japanese soup stock), ¼ cup sake, ¼ cup mirin, ¼ cup sugar, and the dried red chili pepper. Add the rest of the ginger slices and place the otoshibuta (drop lid) on top. Do not cover with the pot's lid. Start cooking on medium heat. Once simmering, reduce the heat to low or medium low and cook, uncovered, on a gentle simmer. Set a timer for 1 hour. At the halfway point (30 minutes), add ¼ cup soy sauce. Tip: We add the soy sauce later on to keep the meat from cooking in it a long time and becoming salty. Add the peeled soft-boiled eggs to the pot. Place the otoshibuta (drop lid) on the meat and continue simmering, uncovered, for the remaining 30 minutes. If the cooking liquid gets low, reduce the heat to low (your stove's lowest setting). Occasionally, shake the pot to coat the meat and eggs with the braising liquid. Make sure there‘s enough liquid in the pot so the pork and eggs don‘t burn. It should be plenty of liquid; if your liquid is low, you might have been cooking on higher heat. After braising for 1 hour, turn off the heat. It's now ready to serve. Use the white part of 1 Tokyo negi (naga negi; long green onion) to make shiraga negi. First, cut the white part into pieces that are 3 inches (7.6 cm) long. Then, make a lengthwise incision to remove the soft green core (save it for another use). Stack the outer layers, holding them flat against the cutting board, and slice lengthwise into very thin julienned strips. Soak in a bowl of iced water for 5–10 minutes to remove the bitterness, and drain well. Tip: For step-by-step photos, see my tutorial on How To Make Shiraga Negi. Serve the Kakuni, eggs, and snap peas in individual bowls. Drizzle with some braising liquid and garnish on top with shiraga negi. Season with optional shichimi togarashi (Japanese seven spice) for a spicy kick. For a more flavorful Kakuni, wait several hours before serving. Kakuni tastes best when gradually cooled in the braising liquid, allowing the food to absorb more flavors. Gently reheat thoroughly and serve. If you prefer a less oily Kakuni, serve it the next day. Let it cool completely, then refrigerate the pork belly in its braising liquid overnight. The next day, remove and discard the solidified fat. Gently reheat the Kakuni thoroughly and serve. You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3–4 days and in the freezer for a month
cooklang:
Pound the @pork belly{450%g} on both sides to tenderize it

Press and mold the meat into its original shape. Cut into 5cm cubes.

Heat a #skillet with @oil{} over medium-high heat. When hot, add the meat with the fat on the surface of the pan. Cook and make sure sides are nicely browned.

Transfer the pieces to a plate covered with paper towels to absorb the fat.

Cut @ginger{1%knob} into thin slides. Set aside half of them for later.

Cut the greeen part of the @green onions{2} into 5cm. pieces. Set the white part apart for garnish.

In a #large pot{}, put the pork belly, green onions, and half of the sliced ginger with enough @water{} to cover the meat.

Boil over high heat and then reduce it to a simmer. Cook uncovered for ~{2%hours} or more (suggested: 3 hours). Occasionally, turn the pork. When the liquid is running low, add more hot water.

Meanwhile, hard-boil the @eggs{3} and peel them. Set aside.

Use the white part of the green onion to make "shiraga negi". First, cut the white part into pieces that are 3 inches (7.6 cm) long. Then, make a lengthwise incision to remove the soft green core (save for another use). Stack the outer layers, holding them flat against the cutting board, and slice lengthwise into very thin julienned strips. Soak in a bowl of iced water for 10 minutes to remove the bitterness, and drain well. Set it aside to use later as a garnish.

After cooking for 2 hours, drain the water and remove the pork to a paper towel to wipe off the excess oil.

To a large, heavy-bottomed pot, add the cooked pork belly, @dashi{}, @sake{}, and @mirin{}. Start cooking on medium heat.

Add the @sugar{}, @soy sauce{}, the rest of the ginger slices, and the @red chili pepper{} (or merken).

When it reaches a boil, reduce the heat to low or medium-low to maintain a simmer. Place an otoshibuta (drop lid) on top of the meat; do not cover the pot with the regular pot lid. Cook for ~{30%min}.

Add the peeled hard-boiled eggs to the pot. Remove the drop lid. Cook for another ~{30%min}. If the liquid is low, reduce the heat. Occasionally, braise the meat with the braising liquid and turn the ingredients. Make sure there is always enough liquid, but prefer to lower the heat than to adding more water.

Serve the Kakunui and eggs with the garnish on top.
predict_cooklang:
Gather 450g pork belly, oil, 1 knob ginger, 2 green onions, water, 3 eggs, dashi, sake, mirin, sugar, soy sauce, and red chili pepper.
Make quick dashi using a packet (3 minutes).
Leave the eggs in the refrigerator until ready to use.
Cut the pork belly into pieces for cooking.
Cook the pork belly in a pot with an otoshibuta (drop lid) on top for 3 hours, adding water as needed to keep it submerged.
Remove the pork belly and let it cool.
Strain and reserve the cooking liquid as a stock for other recipes.
Cut the pork belly into smaller pieces for braising.
Braise the pork belly in a pot with an otoshibuta (drop lid) on top for 1 hour, adding dashi, sake, mirin, sugar, soy sauce, and ginger slices.
Add the peeled soft-boiled eggs to the pot during the last 30 minutes of braising.
Cook the snap peas by blanching them in boiling water until tender.
Make shiraga negi by cutting the white part of a Tokyo negi into pieces, removing the green core, and slicing it lengthwise into thin strips.
Serve the Kakuni, eggs, and snap peas in individual bowls, drizzling with braising liquid and garnishing with shiraga negi.

name: easy-pancakes
ingredients: 3  eggs,125 g flour,250 ml milk,1 pinch sea salt,some  butter,some  oil
method: Crack the eggs into a blender, then add the flour, milk and 1 pinch of sea salt, and blitz until smooth.Pour into a bowl and leave to stand for 15 minutes.Melt the butter (or a drizzle of oil if you want to be a bit healthier) in a large non-stick frying pan on a medium heat, then tilt the pan so the butter coats the surface.Pour in 1 ladle of batter and tilt again, so that the batter spreads all over the base, then cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until it starts to come away from the sides.Once golden underneath, flip the pancake over and cook for 1 further minute, or until cooked through.Serve straightaway with your favourite topping
cooklang:
Crack the @eggs{3} into a blender, then add the @flour{125%g}, @milk{250%ml} and @sea salt{1%pinch}, and blitz until smooth.

Pour into a #bowl and leave to stand for ~{15%minutes}.

Melt the @butter (or a drizzle of @oil if you want to be a bit healthier) in a #large non-stick frying pan{} on a medium heat, then tilt the pan so the butter coats the surface.

Pour in 1 ladle of batter and tilt again, so that the batter spreads all over the base, then cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until it starts to come away from the sides.

Once golden underneath, flip the pancake over and cook for 1 further minute, or until cooked through.

Serve straightaway with your favourite topping. -- Add your favorite topping here to make sure it's included in your meal plan!
predict_cooklang:
INGREDIENTS:
- eggs
- 125g flour
- 250ml milk
- pinch sea salt
- butter
- oil

RECIPE:
1. CRACK eggs INTO blender
2. ADD flour, milk, AND pinch sea salt TO blender; BLITZ UNTIL SMOOTH
3. LEAVE mixture TO stand FOR 15 minutes IN bowl
4. MELT butter (OR drizzle oil) IN large non-stick frying pan ON medium heat
5. TILT pan SO butter COATS surface
6. POUR 1 ladle OF batter INTO pan; TILT AGAIN SO batter SPREADS all over base
7. COOK FOR 1 TO 2 minutes, OR until mixture STARTS to come away FROM sides
8. FLIP pancake OVER; COOK FOR 1 further minute, OR until cooked THROUGH
9. SERVE straightaway WITH favourite topping

name: Taco Seasoning
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chili powder,1.5 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon salt,1 teaspoon ground black pepper,0.5 teaspoon ground paprika,0.25 teaspoon garlic powder,0.25 teaspoon onion powder,0.25 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes,0.25 teaspoon dried oregano
method: Gather all ingredients. Mix chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, red pepper flakes, and oregano together in a small bowl until combined. Store in an airtight container
cooklang: Mix together @chili powder{1%tablespoon}, @ground cumin{1.5%teaspoon}, @salt{1%teaspoon}, @ground black pepper{1%teaspoon}, @ground paprika{0.5%teaspoon}, @garlic powder{0.25%teaspoon}, @onion powder{0.25%teaspoon}, @crushed red pepper flakes{0.25%teaspoon}, @dried oregano{0.25%teaspoon}.
